arts.sum: Victor Osimhen believes his bicycle kick against Antalyaspor on Saturday deserves to be nominated for the Puskas Award. Following Galatasaray’s win over Antalyaspor, Osimhen told reporters: “The goal was an incredible one.

arts.ttl: Empoli Sporting Director disputes penalty decision in Napoli match
arts.sum: In the aftermath of Empoli’s 1-0 defeat to Napoli, the club’s sporting director Roberto Gemmi stepped in for manager Roberto D’Aversa, who was indisposed, to address the media. Gemmi’s comments focused primarily on the controversial penalty decision that ultimately decided the match. Speaking to DAZN, Gemmi strongly contested referee Rosario Abisso’s decision to award Napoli a penalty for an alleged foul by Tino Anjorin on Matteo Politano. “There is no contact between Anjorin and Politano. There is space between the two feet. arts.ttl: Antonio Conte's halftime talk works as Napoli improves to beat Empoli
arts.sum: A Khvicha Kvaratskhelia penalty was enough to see Napoli secure the victory and move three points clear in Serie A ahead of Inter Milan’s match at Roma later. Whatever Antonio Conte told his players at halftime must have worked as Napoli managed to beat Empoli 1-0 in Serie A on Sunday after a much improved second period.

arts.ttl: Napoli Player Ratings vs Empoli: Khvicha Safe From the Spot
arts.sum: Serie A title hopefuls Napoli had to dig deep to take three points against a spirited Empoli side at Stadio Carlo Castellani. Khvicha Kvaratskhelia scored from the spot to propel the Partenopei to a narrow 1-0 win in the lunchtime kick-off. arts.ttl: Serie A | Empoli 0-1 Napoli: Match Report
arts.sum: Serie A leaders Napoli maintained their position at the top of the table with a hard-fought 1-0 victory over Empoli at the Stadio Carlo Castellani. The match was decided by a late Khvicha Kvaratskhelia penalty, as the visitors struggled to break down a determined Empoli side. The home team, still unbeaten before this encounter, started brightly and created several early chances. Sebastiano Esposito tested ex-Empoli goalkeeper Elia Caprile with a powerful volley, while Giuseppe Pezzella also forced a save from the Napoli keeper.
